questions.question: In the United States, what circuit does black wire insulation indicate in a three-wire 120 V cable?
What is required when climbing an antenna tower?

answers.text: Have sufficient training on safe tower climbing techniques
Use appropriate tie-off to the tower at all times
Always wear an approved climbing harness

questions.question: What is the definition of duty cycle during the averaging time for RF exposure?

answers.text: The difference between the lowest power output and the highest power output of a transmitter
The difference between the PEP and average power output of a transmitter
The percentage of time that a transmitter is transmitting
The percentage of time that a transmitter is not transmitting

questions.question: When is willful interference to other amateur radio stations permitted?

answers.text: To stop another amateur station that is breaking the FCC rules
At any time, stations in the Amateur Radio Service are not protected from willful interference

questions.question: How are US amateurs restricted in segments of bands where the Amateur Radio Service is secondary?

answers.text: U.S. amateurs may find non-amateur stations in those segments, and must avoid interfering with them
U.S. amateurs must give foreign amateur stations priority in those segments
International communications are not permitted in those segments
Digital transmissions are not permitted in those segments

questions.question: Which of the following can result in revocation of the station license or suspension of the operator license?

answers.text: Failure to inform the FCC of any changes in the amateur station following performance of an RF safety environmental evaluation
Failure to provide and maintain a correct email address with the FCC
Failure to obtain FCC type acceptance prior to using a home-built transmitter
Failure to have a copy of your license available at your station

questions.question: What types of amateur stations can automatically retransmit the signals of other amateur stations?
What is an amateur station’s control point?

answers.text: The location of the station’s transmitting antenna
The location of the station’s transmitting apparatus
The location at which the control operator function is performed
The mailing address of the station licensee

questions.question: Who is accountable if a repeater inadvertently retransmits communications that violate the FCC rules?

answers.text: The control operator of the originating station
The control operator of the repeater
Both the originating station and the repeater owner

questions.question: Which of the following is required when making on-the-air test transmissions?

answers.text: Conduct tests only between 10 p.m. and 6 a.m. local time
Notify the FCC of the transmissions

questions.question: Which Q signal indicates that you are changing frequency?
Which of the following are typical duties of a Net Control Station?

answers.text: Choose the regular net meeting time and frequency
Ensure that all stations checking into the net are properly licensed for operation on the net frequency
Call the net to order and direct communications between stations checking in

questions.question: What antenna polarization is normally used for long-distance CW and SSB contacts on the VHF and UHF bands?
What property of a radio wave defines its polarization?

answers.text: The orientation of the electric field
The orientation of the magnetic field
The ratio of the energy in the magnetic field to the energy in the electric field
The ratio of the velocity to the wavelength

questions.question: Which of the following bands may provide long-distance communications via the ionosphere’s F region during the peak of the sunspot cycle?
What function is performed with a transceiver and a digital mode hot spot?

answers.text: Communication using digital voice or data systems via the internet
RTTY encoding and decoding without a computer
High-speed digital communications for meteor scatter

questions.question: Which of the following controls could be used if the voice pitch of a single-sideband signal returning to your CQ call seems too high or low?
Which of the following is a good electrical insulator?
Which is equal to 3.525 MHz?
What is impedance?

answers.text: The opposition to AC current flow
The Q or Quality Factor of a component
The power handling capability of a component

questions.question: What formula is used to calculate resistance in a circuit?
What electrical component is typically constructed as a coil of wire?
How is the cathode lead of a semiconductor diode often marked on the package?
Which of the following is accurately represented in electrical schematics?
What is a relay?
What device converts the RF input and output of a transceiver to another band?
What might be a problem if you receive a report that your audio signal through an FM repeater is distorted or unintelligible?

answers.text: Your transmitter is slightly off frequency
You are in a bad location

questions.question: Which of the following causes failure of coaxial cables?

answers.text: Rapid fluctuation in transmitter output power
Operation at 100% duty cycle for an extended period

questions.question: How is a voltmeter connected to a component to measure applied voltage?
Which type of voice mode is often used for long-distance (weak signal) contacts on the VHF and UHF bands?
Who may receive telemetry from a space station?

answers.text: A licensed radio amateur with a transmitter equipped for interrogating the satellite
A licensed radio amateur who has been certified by the protocol developer
A licensed radio amateur who has registered for an access code from AMSAT

questions.question: What is required before using the EchoLink system?

answers.text: Purchase a license to use the EchoLink software
Register your call sign and provide proof of license

questions.question: What type of transmission is indicated by the term "NTSC?"

answers.text: A Normal Transmission mode in Static Circuit
A special mode for satellite uplink
An analog fast-scan color TV signal
A frame compression scheme for TV signals

questions.question: What is a disadvantage of the short, flexible antenna supplied with most handheld radio transceivers, compared to a full-sized quarter-wave antenna?

answers.text: It transmits only circularly polarized signals

questions.question: What is standing wave ratio (SWR)?

answers.text: A measure of how well a load is matched to a transmission line
The ratio of amplifier power output to input
An indication of the quality of your station’s ground connection
